feed.title: Beauty Buy or Beware: Nail Polish

content.div:
This week, the Dose.ca team put some of our favourite nail polish brands to the test. Find out which ones lived up to their claim and which ones fell short of the competition.



Rimmel Lasting Finish (available at drug stores)

“The wand for the Rimmel Lasting Finish was wider than I’m used to, so with my clumsy hands, I almost immediately painted polish right onto my finger. After I quickly adjusted my application technique, however, I was pleasantly surprised – the Rimmel polish went on easily and only took two coats to get the look I wanted. However, I have to take issue with the bottle’s claim that it can last 10 days, as my colour began chipping around the edges only five days later; by Day 7 it looked like I had run my fingernails over a cheese grater. Maybe I should have added a third or a fourth coat, but as it was, the Rimmel Lasting Finish already took an inordinately long time to dry. Without the 10-day claim, I wouldn’t have a problem with Rimmel Lasting Finish, but since it failed to live up to its own criteria, I have to reduce its grade." Rating: 2/5 – Kat Angus, TV editor, Dose.ca


Sally Hansen Insta-Dri (available at drug stores)

“The first thing I noticed about this polish was its fantastic brush. It’s flatter, wider and softer than any I’ve used before, making the polish incredibly easy to apply. The brush is so big that one stroke covers the entire nail. I applied two coats of the Insta-Dri and it lived up to its name: it was completely dry in a matter of minutes. The finished product looked great and provided a nice shine. The only downside was its lack of staying power; it began chipping away by Day 3. To be fair, though, for testing purposes I didn’t add my usual clear top coat (I’m a big fan of China Glaze’s No Chip Top Coat), so it might have lasted longer had I not skipped that step." Rating: 3/5 – Jen McDonnell, managing editor, Dose.ca


O.P.I. (available at salons)

“Three coats and seven days later my nails look exactly as you'd expect: like a glamorous hobo's. That's not a bad thing (especially if you live under a bridge...not that I do, MOM). The tips are chipped -- thoroughly so on my right hand. (My x-treme lifestyle of typing and Googling are no doubt to blame -- not to mention the fact I skipped out on top coat as per our scientific methods.) But apart from a small chip on Day 1, the O.P.I. shade I sampled from their Spring/Summer ‘11 Texas collection maintained its respectability until Day 5. If I had been wearing nail polish for anything other than a Beauty Buy or Beware review, I would've messed with Texas way sooner than that; my nail polish attention span can be fleeting. (As for what's available in this collection, I'm partial to the pearly ice-blue "I Vant to Be A-Lone Star" and dark neutrals like "Suzi Loves Cowboys" though daring corals and fuschia's dominate the palette.) As for the application: it took three coats to achieve the consistency of colour I wanted, but the reasonably quick dry time offset any frustration over that. Where'd I stash the nail polish remover? I'm having another go..." Rating: 4/5 – Leah Collins, music editor, Dose.ca


Sally Hansen Complete Salon Manicure (available at drug stores)

"This week I was happily assigned to the Sally Hansen Complete Salon Manicure polish. This baby claims to be "All 5 Steps of a Manicure in 1 Bottle" -- in only two coats. While this is one of the best nail polishes I’ve tried, I think they bent the truth a little bit on their claim. For testing purposes, I bypassed the base coat and jumped straight to the colour. The directions suggest applying two coats of the polish and allowing it to dry, but I had to apply three thick coats to get the shade to look right. On the bright side, it dried quickly. My nails usually don't like polish, and I've come to accept that. Surprisingly, the Sally Hansen Complete Salon Manicure managed to last more than one day -- making it a winner in my book! I didn't start to notice the chipping until late into Day 2 and with the fast drying time, I was able to touch up my digits quickly before heading out the door. I think if I applied a clear top coat, it may have lasted even longer. Rating: 4/5." - Miranda Furtado, style & social networking editor, Dose.ca
